About this Meetup Group

Happy drumming to you all!

Saturday, June 19, 2010 2PM

(Rain date is Sunday, June 20, 2010 at 4PM.)

Alan, Fanta, Janie and Stu!

The DrumConnection

Meet other local Hand-Drummers who are interested creating community through the rich history of Africa and it's people. Drum Circles are a great way to stay connected to our inner rhythms. You'll learn some new rhythms, get some technique help and meet some great people!

We will come together at 2PM at our Charles River Location (below) Please call 781-648-0066 for further info or just come! Bring your drums or use ours. We will have plenty of drums and supply the water. We can make a Bar-B-Que of it! I've got a new grille. I'll bring charcoal and some food. Email me to see what would be good to bring. On the day of the circle: call 617.686.6080, Alan's cell.

Donations: $15.- each. Children under 12 - Free.

Recent feedback...

"Had a wonderful time.... The circle was very welcoming and Alan is a competent, incredibly talented, patient and friendly leader. I really had a wonderful time and I'm hoping to make it a regular activity and perhaps bring a friend. ”
Irene

“ This was a fun time. Alan's leadership style is loose, offering suggestions and some instruction. Nice group of people, too.”
Denise

“ It is the best drumming circle in the area! People really come together in a community, and with a community spirit. Instruments are provided if you don't have one. ... ”

DIRECTIONS!

Get a chair and put it in your car tonight!

SATURDAY! The DRUMCONNECTION DRUMCIRCLE!

DRUMMING CIRCLES on the Banks of The River Charles.

Saturday June 19, 2010
2:00PM - 6:00PM
$15.- donation
Bring food to share.

Here's what you need to know:

You need a folding chair available and inexpensive at Costco, Staples, Target, Kmart, Bed/Bath (or borrow one from work or school). We'll have a few extra. And we'll have a few extra drums to share.

It's even more important this time of year to remember to bring WATER.

If you're lost, call me: 617-686-6080.

Directions: We will be meeting in the park on Soldier's Field Road, PARKING LOT #4, specifically the large parking lot for the Publick Theater #4 ,which is across from the Days Inn, near WBZ-TV and the State Police Building. Huge parking lot...can’t miss it! Parking is NOT a problem. There is a traffic light where you turn into the parking lot, if you are coming from Newton Corner past the IHOP and other shopping - there's a left turn lane with a light and a sign that says "Publick Theater".

If you are coming from Boston/Cambridge, it's a right turn (no traffic light) - again look for the Publick Theater signs. The signs will lead you to a large parking lot across from the Days Inn, and we will be waiting for you over by the river at the far end of the parking lot near the playground. Here's a link to a great Google map with the little pointer right where we're going:
